pages:
June 16, 2021
Alison Morrison
Gratiot County DHHS
201 Commerce Drive
Ithaca, MI 48847
RE: License #: CP290201154
Gratiot County DHHS
201 Commerce Drive
Ithaca, MI 48847
Dear Ms. Morrison:
Your Child Placing Agency certificate of approval license is renewed. It is valid only at
your present address and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30
days in advance. You will be receiving the certificate of approval in the mail. Please
review it for accuracy.
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
06/16/2021. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation, Sustainability
and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing
rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. As indicated above substantial
compliance has been established therefore, your certificate of approval license is
renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the interim evaluation
completed 11/25/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that
evaluation were R 400.12327 (1)(a)(5)(d), R 400.12405 (4), R 400.12418 (2)(a), and
ISEP 6.49. None of these areas were identified as repeat noncompliance as a part
of this renewal review.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
2
